pull_request.title: Allow removeField() on contextual field names
pull_request.body:
On a field defined with context:
```yaml
dates@update:
    label: Other dates
   ...
```
Then in `backend.form.extendFields` event, the `$widget->removeField('dates')` method doesn't work.  

This PR allow `removeField()` method to work on contextualized fields name.

commits.message:
Fix support for data-request-parent

Fixes bug introduced in https://github.com/wintercms/winter/commit/9637b67c239c1e9a5d4a3057beb3062fb5a56069 that broke support for data-request-parent.
Improve IDE knowledge of the PluginBase object

Allow detached AJAX request to be called with 2 params

This allows Snowboard.request() to be called with two params, assuming that no element is attached to the request.
Allow for custom AJAX error responses to be passed through handlers
Merge branch 'develop' of github.com:wintercms/winter into develop
Add test case for getParentData method in AJAX framework
Removed NPX from webpack bin call (#728)
Change event doc to test new event functionality in Docs plugin
Add "Send password reset email" button to backend users update page (#723)

Add migrate to list of protected commands (#733)

Prevents issues with unelevated plugins that expect the database to exist always.

Update jobs tables to support Laravel 9 (#730)

Updates `failed_jobs` table to add missing `uuid` column. This also updates the `payload` and `exception` columns to be inline with the default Laravel migration.

Fix Navigation Manager unit test

The Singleton changes introduced to Storm (https://github.com/wintercms/storm/commit/ca5959495b8f551da1f1c5174666cf0fdb003c13) that bind singletons to the app means that in unit tests, we will need to re-initialise any scope we need for tests, as the app is cleared upon each test case being run.
Added CLI signature to mix:list command

Set pivot data when initially syncing the relationship (#739)

Also performs the sync with model instances rather than just raw IDs to support relationships with a custom relatedKey set (the key on the related model's table that is stored on the pivot table to connect the relationship, normally just the primary key but can be anything).
Switch from using Request::getBasePath() to Url::asset() (#742)
Bugfix lightGallery plugins in galleries components.

issue.title: Conditionnal routing
issue.body:
By default the plugin adds the following routes to the site: 
 - `/humans.txt`
 - `/robots.txt`
 - `/security.txt`
 - `/.well-known/security.txt`

My problem is that in the `robots.txt` file the `Sitemap` properties must contain the domain name.
https://developers.google.com/search/docs/crawling-indexing/sitemaps/build-sitemap
> The sitemap URL must be a fully-qualified URL

To solve this problem I have created a dedicated page in this form: 
```twig
title = "Robots file"
url = "/robots.txt"
is_hidden = 0
==
<?php
    function onEnd()
    {
        /**
         * Change the content type to text/plain
         */
        $this->controller->setResponseHeader('Content-Type', 'text/plain');
    }
?>
==
# Begin robots.txt file
#
# Exclude Files From All Robots:
User-agent: *
Disallow: /bootstrap/
Disallow: /config/
Disallow: /vendor/

# Sitemaps
Sitemap: {{ '/' | app }}sitemap.xml

# End robots.txt file
```
This way, there is no need to change the domain in the text file at the site root.  
The routes defined in this plugin take priority on that page of the website.

So I ask the question if it is possible to declare these routes **only** if they are enabled through the plugin settings?

comment.body:
>     * We could support twig parsing of the .txt file settings
> 
>     * We could automatically generate a generically useful robots.txt when none is present in the settings that would solve the use case of most people and automatically detect the sitemap plugin's configuration

Great ideas.  

I'm sure this plugin can become a must-have in the Winter SEO optimization field.

issue.title: Fancy layout styling
issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

dev-develop

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

MySQL/MariaDB

### Plugins installed

Winter.Test

### Issue description

PR #763 introduce degenerative styles when using nested forms under repeater fields.

### winter/wn-backend-module 1.2.1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203379877-63e81c06-d3aa-4960-b5cb-ad2d47eb0490.png)

### winter/wn-backend-module dev-develop 8972c89
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203380513-ead7e01e-66c6-4070-a98a-9869c7847b98.png)

**Lost padding:**

Tab panes have lost their inner padding.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203390977-6c149cb7-4dd9-4516-b19b-ffef0e0b884b.png)


**Extras chevron:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203387393-74c445f3-8821-42a2-ab04-d7408a6da837.png)

The extra `right chevron` seems to come from: 
https://github.com/wintercms/winter/blob/develop/modules/system/assets/ui/storm.css#L1226
```css
.control-tabs.scroll-after::after {
  display: block;
}
```

**Note:**
On my screenshots, the repeated section fields have a dedicated `small-panels` class added which allows me to remove the unnecessary padding.
```css
.small-panels .field-repeater li.field-repeater-item {
  padding: 0 !important;
}
```


### Steps to replicate

 - Install Winter
 - Install this fork/commit of Winter.Test plugin to have the complex field for page model https://github.com/damsfx/wn-test-plugin/commit/d4b773f064f87363f5364194fa65f25d8565b873 
 - Go to backend to edit the complex page

### Workaround

_No response_

issue.title: Clean up default UX
issue.body:
There are a lot of third party custom search providers included by default. In my opinion these should live within the plugins they are for (and if that's not possible, then at the very least the existence of the plugin they're for should be checked on the settings page before displaying that provider's options).

On another note, it would be ideal if the Settings model could pull defaults from a plugin configuration file (see how October implements it: https://github.com/octobercms/october/blob/master/modules/backend/models/BrandSetting.php#L77 - although you'd want to override the get method of the settings model in this case to load from config when an item is requested to retain full support for custom provider's settings). I try to avoid any database configuration in my projects instead utilizing configuration files and the environment file as this enables the code to configure itself without requiring any manual intervention on deployment to new servers.

In my opinion these should live within the plugins they are for (and if that's not possible, then at the very least the existence of the plugin they're for should be checked on the settings page before displaying that provider's options).

This par of the issue is resolved with #124 .

issue.title: Deadlocks  - Serialization failure: 1213 Deadlock found when trying to get lock;

comment.body:
> @damsfx any idea?

100 orders per minute?
Normal users orders or generated ones?

The `CartProduct->moveToOrder()` method make use of transaction inside the `Oder->fromCart()` method witch use them too.
I think the lock on the `offline_mall_order_products` is not release yet when a new `moveToOrder()` appears.  

Maybe you can try to see where the most recent deadlock happened : 
`SHOW ENGINE INNODB STATUS \G`
and search for a section nmaed **LATEST DETECTED DEADLOCK**.  
It can give you a more detailed reason why the error occurs.

@tobias-kuendig any thoughts?

issue.title: Allow wishlist load by page parameter
issue.body:
This PR is aimed to allow Wishlist page to load a specific wish list item by passing his hashed Id as parameter.   
**The `id` parameter must be set with an hash id** : `https://mall.offline.swiss/en/wishlists/r8dolq6Z`.
```twig
title = "Wishlists"
url = "/wishlists/:id?"
layout = "default"
is_hidden = 0

[viewBag]
localeUrl[de] = "/wunschlisten/:id?"

[wishlists]
showShipping = 1
==
{% component 'wishlists' %}
```
If no id parameter is passed, the defaut behavior is used and the first item of the list get loaded.  

This can be useful if you dynamically build a wishlist from the items in the store (example project configurator) and you want to  redirect the visitor to this newly created list.

comment.body:
> I have released version v2.0.13 that includes this change. Thank you for the notice, @damsfx!

Thanks for your time @tobias-kuendig .

issue.title: Avoid Currency dates to be cast as ISO dates
issue.body:
Fix #954 

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale` 
https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

comment.body:
> I wonder if the timestamps even bear any relevance here. Would adding them to the `$hidden` property remove them from the `toArray` output? That way we would not introduce any breaking changes, right?

```php
    protected $hidden = [
        'created_at',
        'updated_at',
    ];
```

I confirm that, adding them to hidden attributes solve the issue with Laravel 9.  
I do not have, at this time, a site in Laravel 6 with version 1.16.3 of the plugin to perform a test.

Strange thing, according to Laravel doc it's possible [customize the date format per attribute](https://laravel.com/docs/9.x/eloquent-serialization#customizing-the-date-format-per-attribute).  
```php
    public $casts = [
        ...
        'created_at' => 'datetime:Y-m-d H:i:s',
        'updated_at' => 'datetime:Y-m-d H:i:s',
    ];
```
But it does not seems to work in that case, maybe because they are timestamp attributes.

issue.title: model->toArray() add timezone to dates
issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

1.2

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

MySQL/MariaDB

### Plugins installed

_No response_

### Issue description

When fetching model's attributes, the dates fields are corrects, but when calling `toArray()` method on the same model, date fields comes with timezone in ISO format.  
If you add to pass this to the `winter/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale()` method it result in an Carbon issue : 
```
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

### Steps to replicate

**In winter 1.2.1**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.2.1.

$ php artisan tinker
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4383
     id: 1,

pull_request.title: Avoid Currency dates to be cast as ISO dates
pull_request.body:
Fix #954 

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale` https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

issue.title: Error with Carbon Creator
issue.body:
Hi,

after creating order I'm getting this error:

Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException: Unexpected data found.
Trailing data in /home/lessem/public_html/vendor/nesbot/carbon/src/Carbon/Traits/Creator.php:676

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14330711/189879913-d0b94815-bb93-4721-a387-c158bab045b8.PNG)

My setup:
- October 3.0.72
- Mall plugin 2.0.8
- PHP 8.0.22
- Composer 2.2.5

comment.body:
Same error here after updating a site to Laravel 9.  
The issue come from the `toArray()` method used in Currency model.
https://github.com/OFFLINE-GmbH/oc-mall-plugin/blob/97cd64446fb9437b1261c4cb5763d779fc12565c/models/Currency.php#L152

In Laravel v6, `toArray()` return a formated date like `2022-09-20 14:57:36`.  
In Laravel v9, `toArray()` return a formated date like `2022-09-20T14:57:36.000000Z`, and result in an issue when trying to convert a cart to order.

You need to delete your current session to see this issue.

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale`
https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

pull_request.title: Allow wishlist load by page parameter
pull_request.body:
This PR is aimed to allow Wishlist page to load a specific wish list item by passing his hashed Id as parameter.   
**The `id` parameter must be set with an hash id** : `https://mall.offline.swiss/en/wishlists/r8dolq6Z`.
```twig
title = "Wishlists"
url = "/wishlists/:id?"
layout = "default"
is_hidden = 0

[viewBag]
localeUrl[de] = "/wunschlisten/:id?"

[wishlists]
showShipping = 1
==
{% component 'wishlists' %}
```
If no id parameter is passed, the defaut behavior is used and the first item of the list get loaded.  

This can be useful if you dynamically build a wishlist from the items in the store (example project configurator) and you want to  redirect the visitor to this newly created list.

pull_request.title: Allow removeField() on contextual field names
pull_request.body:
On a field defined with context:
```yaml
dates@update:
    label: Other dates
   ...
```
Then in `backend.form.extendFields` event, the `$widget->removeField('dates')` method doesn't work.  

This PR allow `removeField()` method to work on contextualized fields name.

Fix support for data-request-parent

Fixes bug introduced in https://github.com/wintercms/winter/commit/9637b67c239c1e9a5d4a3057beb3062fb5a56069 that broke support for data-request-parent.
Improve IDE knowledge of the PluginBase object

Allow detached AJAX request to be called with 2 params

This allows Snowboard.request() to be called with two params, assuming that no element is attached to the request.
Allow for custom AJAX error responses to be passed through handlers
Merge branch 'develop' of github.com:wintercms/winter into develop
Add test case for getParentData method in AJAX framework
Removed NPX from webpack bin call (#728)
Change event doc to test new event functionality in Docs plugin
Add "Send password reset email" button to backend users update page (#723)

Add migrate to list of protected commands (#733)

Prevents issues with unelevated plugins that expect the database to exist always.

Update jobs tables to support Laravel 9 (#730)

Updates `failed_jobs` table to add missing `uuid` column. This also updates the `payload` and `exception` columns to be inline with the default Laravel migration.

Fix Navigation Manager unit test

The Singleton changes introduced to Storm (https://github.com/wintercms/storm/commit/ca5959495b8f551da1f1c5174666cf0fdb003c13) that bind singletons to the app means that in unit tests, we will need to re-initialise any scope we need for tests, as the app is cleared upon each test case being run.
Added CLI signature to mix:list command

Set pivot data when initially syncing the relationship (#739)

Also performs the sync with model instances rather than just raw IDs to support relationships with a custom relatedKey set (the key on the related model's table that is stored on the pivot table to connect the relationship, normally just the primary key but can be anything).
Switch from using Request::getBasePath() to Url::asset() (#742)

issue.title: Conditionnal routing
issue.body:
By default the plugin adds the following routes to the site: 
 - `/humans.txt`
 - `/robots.txt`
 - `/security.txt`
 - `/.well-known/security.txt`

My problem is that in the `robots.txt` file the `Sitemap` properties must contain the domain name.
https://developers.google.com/search/docs/crawling-indexing/sitemaps/build-sitemap
> The sitemap URL must be a fully-qualified URL

To solve this problem I have created a dedicated page in this form: 
```twig
title = "Robots file"
url = "/robots.txt"
is_hidden = 0
==
<?php
    function onEnd()
    {
        /**
         * Change the content type to text/plain
         */
        $this->controller->setResponseHeader('Content-Type', 'text/plain');
    }
?>
==
# Begin robots.txt file
#
# Exclude Files From All Robots:
User-agent: *
Disallow: /bootstrap/
Disallow: /config/
Disallow: /vendor/

# Sitemaps
Sitemap: {{ '/' | app }}sitemap.xml

# End robots.txt file
```
This way, there is no need to change the domain in the text file at the site root.  
The routes defined in this plugin take priority on that page of the website.

So I ask the question if it is possible to declare these routes **only** if they are enabled through the plugin settings?

comment.body:
>     * We could support twig parsing of the .txt file settings
> 
>     * We could automatically generate a generically useful robots.txt when none is present in the settings that would solve the use case of most people and automatically detect the sitemap plugin's configuration

Great ideas.  

I'm sure this plugin can become a must-have in the Winter SEO optimization field.

issue.title: Fancy layout styling
issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

dev-develop

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

MySQL/MariaDB

### Plugins installed

Winter.Test

### Issue description

PR #763 introduce degenerative styles when using nested forms under repeater fields.

### winter/wn-backend-module 1.2.1
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203379877-63e81c06-d3aa-4960-b5cb-ad2d47eb0490.png)

### winter/wn-backend-module dev-develop 8972c89
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203380513-ead7e01e-66c6-4070-a98a-9869c7847b98.png)

**Lost padding:**

Tab panes have lost their inner padding.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203390977-6c149cb7-4dd9-4516-b19b-ffef0e0b884b.png)


**Extras chevron:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/282242/203387393-74c445f3-8821-42a2-ab04-d7408a6da837.png)

The extra `right chevron` seems to come from: 
https://github.com/wintercms/winter/blob/develop/modules/system/assets/ui/storm.css#L1226
```css
.control-tabs.scroll-after::after {
  display: block;
}
```

**Note:**
On my screenshots, the repeated section fields have a dedicated `small-panels` class added which allows me to remove the unnecessary padding.
```css
.small-panels .field-repeater li.field-repeater-item {
  padding: 0 !important;
}
```


### Steps to replicate

 - Install Winter
 - Install this fork/commit of Winter.Test plugin to have the complex field for page model https://github.com/damsfx/wn-test-plugin/commit/d4b773f064f87363f5364194fa65f25d8565b873 
 - Go to backend to edit the complex page

### Workaround

_No response_

issue.title: Clean up default UX
issue.body:
There are a lot of third party custom search providers included by default. In my opinion these should live within the plugins they are for (and if that's not possible, then at the very least the existence of the plugin they're for should be checked on the settings page before displaying that provider's options).

On another note, it would be ideal if the Settings model could pull defaults from a plugin configuration file (see how October implements it: https://github.com/octobercms/october/blob/master/modules/backend/models/BrandSetting.php#L77 - although you'd want to override the get method of the settings model in this case to load from config when an item is requested to retain full support for custom provider's settings). I try to avoid any database configuration in my projects instead utilizing configuration files and the environment file as this enables the code to configure itself without requiring any manual intervention on deployment to new servers.

In my opinion these should live within the plugins they are for (and if that's not possible, then at the very least the existence of the plugin they're for should be checked on the settings page before displaying that provider's options).

This par of the issue is resolved with #124 .

issue.title: Deadlocks  - Serialization failure: 1213 Deadlock found when trying to get lock;

comment.body:
> @damsfx any idea?

100 orders per minute?
Normal users orders or generated ones?

The `CartProduct->moveToOrder()` method make use of transaction inside the `Oder->fromCart()` method witch use them too.
I think the lock on the `offline_mall_order_products` is not release yet when a new `moveToOrder()` appears.  

Maybe you can try to see where the most recent deadlock happened : 
`SHOW ENGINE INNODB STATUS \G`
and search for a section nmaed **LATEST DETECTED DEADLOCK**.  
It can give you a more detailed reason why the error occurs.

@tobias-kuendig any thoughts?

issue.title: Allow wishlist load by page parameter
issue.body:
This PR is aimed to allow Wishlist page to load a specific wish list item by passing his hashed Id as parameter.   
**The `id` parameter must be set with an hash id** : `https://mall.offline.swiss/en/wishlists/r8dolq6Z`.
```twig
title = "Wishlists"
url = "/wishlists/:id?"
layout = "default"
is_hidden = 0

[viewBag]
localeUrl[de] = "/wunschlisten/:id?"

[wishlists]
showShipping = 1
==
{% component 'wishlists' %}
```
If no id parameter is passed, the defaut behavior is used and the first item of the list get loaded.  

This can be useful if you dynamically build a wishlist from the items in the store (example project configurator) and you want to  redirect the visitor to this newly created list.

comment.body:
> I have released version v2.0.13 that includes this change. Thank you for the notice, @damsfx!

Thanks for your time @tobias-kuendig .

issue.title: Avoid Currency dates to be cast as ISO dates
issue.body:
Fix #954 

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale` 
https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

comment.body:
> I wonder if the timestamps even bear any relevance here. Would adding them to the `$hidden` property remove them from the `toArray` output? That way we would not introduce any breaking changes, right?

```php
    protected $hidden = [
        'created_at',
        'updated_at',
    ];
```

I confirm that, adding them to hidden attributes solve the issue with Laravel 9.  
I do not have, at this time, a site in Laravel 6 with version 1.16.3 of the plugin to perform a test.

Strange thing, according to Laravel doc it's possible [customize the date format per attribute](https://laravel.com/docs/9.x/eloquent-serialization#customizing-the-date-format-per-attribute).  
```php
    public $casts = [
        ...
        'created_at' => 'datetime:Y-m-d H:i:s',
        'updated_at' => 'datetime:Y-m-d H:i:s',
    ];
```
But it does not seems to work in that case, maybe because they are timestamp attributes.

issue.title: model->toArray() add timezone to dates
issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

1.2

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

MySQL/MariaDB

### Plugins installed

_No response_

### Issue description

When fetching model's attributes, the dates fields are corrects, but when calling `toArray()` method on the same model, date fields comes with timezone in ISO format.  
If you add to pass this to the `winter/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale()` method it result in an Carbon issue : 
```
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

### Steps to replicate

**In winter 1.2.1**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.2.1.

$ php artisan tinker
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4383
     id: 1,
     user_id: 1,
     ip_address: "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx",
     created_at: "2021-04-26 13:44:06",
     updated_at: "2021-04-26 13:44:06",
   }

>>> $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26 13:44:06"

>>> $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26T13:44:06.000000Z"

>>> $attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26 13:44:06"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1619444646 {#4351
     date: 2021-04-26 13:44:06.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26T13:44:06.000000Z"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

**In winter 1.1.9**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.1.9.

$ php artisan tinker
Psy Shell v0.11.8 (PHP 8.0.20 — cli) by Justin Hileman
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4079
     id: 1,
     user_id: 1,
     ip_address: "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx",
     created_at: "2018-08-28 14:24:35",
     updated_at: "2018-08-28 14:24:35",
   }

>>> $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>>
>>>
>>> $attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4192
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4268
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }
```

You can quickly test it by tinkering : 
```bash
$access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
$access->attributes['created_at'];
$access->toArray()['created_at'];

$attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);

$array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
```

### Workaround

_No response_

comment.body:
> I don't think this necessarily counts as a bug within Winter, as it's a change introduced by Laravel, unless this is breaking a feature within Winter.

Totally agree with you.  
Sorry for the noise.

pull_request.body:
Fix #954 

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale` https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

issue.title: Error with Carbon Creator
issue.body:
Hi,

after creating order I'm getting this error:

Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException: Unexpected data found.
Trailing data in /home/lessem/public_html/vendor/nesbot/carbon/src/Carbon/Traits/Creator.php:676

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14330711/189879913-d0b94815-bb93-4721-a387-c158bab045b8.PNG)

My setup:
- October 3.0.72
- Mall plugin 2.0.8
- PHP 8.0.22
- Composer 2.2.5

comment.body:
Same error here after updating a site to Laravel 9.  
The issue come from the `toArray()` method used in Currency model.
https://github.com/OFFLINE-GmbH/oc-mall-plugin/blob/97cd64446fb9437b1261c4cb5763d779fc12565c/models/Currency.php#L152

In Laravel v6, `toArray()` return a formated date like `2022-09-20 14:57:36`.  
In Laravel v9, `toArray()` return a formated date like `2022-09-20T14:57:36.000000Z`, and result in an issue when trying to convert a cart to order.

You need to delete your current session to see this issue.

commits.message:
Avoid Currency dates to be cast as ISO dates

Fix #954 

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale`
https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

issue.title: model->toArray() add timezone to dates
issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

1.2

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

MySQL/MariaDB

### Plugins installed

_No response_

### Issue description

When fetching model's attributes, the dates fields are corrects, but when calling `toArray()` method on the same model, date fields comes with timezone in ISO format.  
If you add to pass this to the `winter/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale()` method it result in an Carbon issue : 
```
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

### Steps to replicate

**In winter 1.2.1**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.2.1.

$ php artisan tinker
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4383
     id: 1,
     user_id: 1,
     ip_address: "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx",
     created_at: "2021-04-26 13:44:06",
     updated_at: "2021-04-26 13:44:06",
   }

>>> $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26 13:44:06"

>>> $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26T13:44:06.000000Z"

>>> $attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26 13:44:06"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1619444646 {#4351
     date: 2021-04-26 13:44:06.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26T13:44:06.000000Z"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

**In winter 1.1.9**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.1.9.

$ php artisan tinker
Psy Shell v0.11.8 (PHP 8.0.20 — cli) by Justin Hileman
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4079
     id: 1,
     user_id: 1,
     ip_address: "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx",
     created_at: "2018-08-28 14:24:35",
     updated_at: "2018-08-28 14:24:35",
   }

>>> $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>>
>>>
>>> $attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4192
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4268
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }
```

You can quickly test it by tinkering : 
```bash
$access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
$access->attributes['created_at'];
$access->toArray()['created_at'];

$attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);

$array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
```

### Workaround

_No response_

pull_request.title: Allow wishlist load by page parameter
pull_request.body:
This PR is aimed to allow Wishlist page to load a specific wish list item by passing his hashed Id as parameter.   
**The `id` parameter must be set with an hash id** : `https://mall.offline.swiss/en/wishlists/r8dolq6Z`.
```twig
title = "Wishlists"
url = "/wishlists/:id?"
layout = "default"
is_hidden = 0

[viewBag]
localeUrl[de] = "/wunschlisten/:id?"

[wishlists]
showShipping = 1
==
{% component 'wishlists' %}
```
If no id parameter is passed, the defaut behavior is used and the first item of the list get loaded.  

This can be useful if you dynamically build a wishlist from the items in the store (example project configurator) and you want to  redirect the visitor to this newly created list.

pull_request.title: Allow removeField() on contextual field names
pull_request.body:
On a field defined with context:
```yaml
dates@update:
    label: Other dates
   ...
```
Then in `backend.form.extendFields` event, the `$widget->removeField('dates')` method doesn't work.  

This PR allow `removeField()` method to work on contextualized fields name.

issue.title: Conditionnal routing
issue.body:
By default the plugin adds the following routes to the site: 
 - `/humans.txt`
 - `/robots.txt`
 - `/security.txt`
 - `/.well-known/security.txt`

My problem is that in the `robots.txt` file the `Sitemap` properties must contain the domain name.
https://developers.google.com/search/docs/crawling-indexing/sitemaps/build-sitemap
> The sitemap URL must be a fully-qualified URL

To solve this problem I have created a dedicated page in this form: 
```twig
title = "Robots file"
url = "/robots.txt"
is_hidden = 0
==
<?php
    function onEnd()
    {
        /**
         * Change the content type to text/plain
         */
        $this->controller->setResponseHeader('Content-Type', 'text/plain');
    }
?>
==
# Begin robots.txt file
#
# Exclude Files From All Robots:
User-agent: *
Disallow: /bootstrap/
Disallow: /config/
Disallow: /vendor/

# Sitemaps
Sitemap: {{ '/' | app }}sitemap.xml

# End robots.txt file
```
This way, there is no need to change the domain in the text file at the site root.  
The routes defined in this plugin take priority on that page of the website.

So I ask the question if it is possible to declare these routes **only** if they are enabled through the plugin settings?

comment.body:
>     * We could support twig parsing of the .txt file settings
> 
>     * We could automatically generate a generically useful robots.txt when none is present in the settings that would solve the use case of most people and automatically detect the sitemap plugin's configuration

Great ideas.  

I'm sure this plugin can become a must-have in the Winter SEO optimization field.

issue.title: Conditionnal routing
issue.body:
By default the plugin adds the following routes to the site: 
 - `/humans.txt`
 - `/robots.txt`
 - `/security.txt`
 - `/.well-known/security.txt`

My problem is that in the `robots.txt` file the `Sitemap` properties must contain the domain name.
https://developers.google.com/search/docs/crawling-indexing/sitemaps/build-sitemap
> The sitemap URL must be a fully-qualified URL

To solve this problem I have created a dedicated page in this form: 
```twig
title = "Robots file"
url = "/robots.txt"
is_hidden = 0
==
<?php
    function onEnd()
    {
        /**
         * Change the content type to text/plain
         */
        $this->controller->setResponseHeader('Content-Type', 'text/plain');
    }
?>
==
# Begin robots.txt file
#
# Exclude Files From All Robots:
User-agent: *
Disallow: /bootstrap/
Disallow: /config/
Disallow: /vendor/

# Sitemaps
Sitemap: {{ '/' | app }}sitemap.xml

# End robots.txt file
```
This way, there is no need to change the domain in the text file at the site root.  
The routes defined in this plugin take priority on that page of the website.

So I ask the question if it is possible to declare these routes **only** if they are enabled through the plugin settings?

issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

dev-develop

### PHP Version

8.0

MySQL/MariaDB

Winter.Test

### Issue description

PR #763 introduce degenerative styles when using nested forms under repeater fields.

issue.title: Clean up default UX
issue.body:
There are a lot of third party custom search providers included by default. In my opinion these should live within the plugins they are for (and if that's not possible, then at the very least the existence of the plugin they're for should be checked on the settings page before displaying that provider's options).

On another note, it would be ideal if the Settings model could pull defaults from a plugin configuration file (see how October implements it: https://github.com/octobercms/october/blob/master/modules/backend/models/BrandSetting.php#L77 - although you'd want to override the get method of the settings model in this case to load from config when an item is requested to retain full support for custom provider's settings). I try to avoid any database configuration in my projects instead utilizing configuration files and the environment file as this enables the code to configure itself without requiring any manual intervention on deployment to new servers.

comment.body:
> @damsfx any idea?

100 orders per minute?
Normal users orders or generated ones?

The `CartProduct->moveToOrder()` method make use of transaction inside the `Oder->fromCart()` method witch use them too.
I think the lock on the `offline_mall_order_products` is not release yet when a new `moveToOrder()` appears.  

Maybe you can try to see where the most recent deadlock happened : 
`SHOW ENGINE INNODB STATUS \G`
and search for a section nmaed **LATEST DETECTED DEADLOCK**.  
It can give you a more detailed reason why the error occurs.

@tobias-kuendig any thoughts?

issue.title: Allow wishlist load by page parameter
issue.body:
This PR is aimed to allow Wishlist page to load a specific wish list item by passing his hashed Id as parameter.   
**The `id` parameter must be set with an hash id** : `https://mall.offline.swiss/en/wishlists/r8dolq6Z`.
```twig
title = "Wishlists"
url = "/wishlists/:id?"
layout = "default"
is_hidden = 0

[viewBag]
localeUrl[de] = "/wunschlisten/:id?"

[wishlists]
showShipping = 1
==
{% component 'wishlists' %}
```
If no id parameter is passed, the defaut behavior is used and the first item of the list get loaded.  

This can be useful if you dynamically build a wishlist from the items in the store (example project configurator) and you want to  redirect the visitor to this newly created list.

issue.title: Avoid Currency dates to be cast as ISO dates
issue.body:
Fix #954 

Cast Currency dates in `Y-m-d H:i:s` format rather than in the ISO one that is resulting in a issue when used in `rain/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale` 
https://github.com/octobercms/library/blob/58b50c972094c95d6349c4920e0b5bf91965cc14/src/Argon/Argon.php#L44

comment.body:
> I wonder if the timestamps even bear any relevance here. Would adding them to the `$hidden` property remove them from the `toArray` output? That way we would not introduce any breaking changes, right?

```php
    protected $hidden = [
        'created_at',
        'updated_at',
    ];
```

I confirm that, adding them to hidden attributes solve the issue with Laravel 9.  
I do not have, at this time, a site in Laravel 6 with version 1.16.3 of the plugin to perform a test.

Strange thing, according to Laravel doc it's possible [customize the date format per attribute](https://laravel.com/docs/9.x/eloquent-serialization#customizing-the-date-format-per-attribute).  
```php
    public $casts = [
        ...
        'created_at' => 'datetime:Y-m-d H:i:s',
        'updated_at' => 'datetime:Y-m-d H:i:s',
    ];
```
But it does not seems to work in that case, maybe because they are timestamp attributes.

issue.title: model->toArray() add timezone to dates
issue.body:
### Winter CMS Build

1.2

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

MySQL/MariaDB

### Plugins installed

_No response_

### Issue description

When fetching model's attributes, the dates fields are corrects, but when calling `toArray()` method on the same model, date fields comes with timezone in ISO format.  
If you add to pass this to the `winter/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale()` method it result in an Carbon issue : 
```
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

### Steps to replicate

**In winter 1.2.1**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.2.1.

$ php artisan tinker
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4383
     id: 1,
     user_id: 1,
     ip_address: "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx",
     created_at: "2021-04-26 13:44:06",
     updated_at: "2021-04-26 13:44:06",
   }

>>> $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26 13:44:06"

>>> $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26T13:44:06.000000Z"

>>> $attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26 13:44:06"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1619444646 {#4351
     date: 2021-04-26 13:44:06.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2021-04-26T13:44:06.000000Z"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.
Trailing data'
```

**In winter 1.1.9**
```bash
$ php artisan winter:version
*** Detecting Winter CMS build...
*** Detected a modified version of Winter CMS build 1.1.9.

$ php artisan tinker
Psy Shell v0.11.8 (PHP 8.0.20 — cli) by Justin Hileman
>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4079
     id: 1,
     user_id: 1,
     ip_address: "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx",
     created_at: "2018-08-28 14:24:35",
     updated_at: "2018-08-28 14:24:35",
   }

>>> $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>>
>>>
>>> $attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4192
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4268
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }
```

You can quickly test it by tinkering : 
```bash
$access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
$access->attributes['created_at'];
$access->toArray()['created_at'];

$attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);

$array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
```

### Workaround

_No response_

issue.title: Error with Carbon Creator
issue.body:
Hi,

after creating order I'm getting this error:

Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException: Unexpected data found.
Trailing data in /home/lessem/public_html/vendor/nesbot/carbon/src/Carbon/Traits/Creator.php:676

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14330711/189879913-d0b94815-bb93-4721-a387-c158bab045b8.PNG)

My setup:
- October 3.0.72
- Mall plugin 2.0.8
- PHP 8.0.22
- Composer 2.2.5

comment.body:
Same error here after updating a site to Laravel 9.  
The issue come from the `toArray()` method used in Currency model.
https://github.com/OFFLINE-GmbH/oc-mall-plugin/blob/97cd64446fb9437b1261c4cb5763d779fc12565c/models/Currency.php#L152

In Laravel v6, `toArray()` return a formated date like `2022-09-20 14:57:36`.  
In Laravel v9, `toArray()` return a formated date like `2022-09-20T14:57:36.000000Z`, and result in an issue when trying to convert a cart to order.

You need to delete your current session to see this issue.

>>> $access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
=> Backend\Models\AccessLog {#4079

>>>
>>>

=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4192
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }

>>>
>>> $array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
=> "2018-08-28 14:24:35"

>>> \Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
=> Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon @1535466275 {#4268
     date: 2018-08-28 14:24:35.0 e (+00:00),
   }
```

You can quickly test it by tinkering : 
```bash
$access = Backend\Models\AccessLog::first();
$access->attributes['created_at'];
$access->toArray()['created_at'];

$attribut = $access->attributes['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $attribut);

$array_attribut = $access->toArray()['created_at'];
\Winter\Storm\Argon\Argon::createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale('Y-m-d H:i:s', $array_attribut);
```

### Workaround

_No response_

issue.title: model->toArray() add timezone to dates

### Winter CMS Build

1.2

### PHP Version

8.0

### Database engine

### Plugins installed

_No response_

If you add to pass this to the `winter/src/Argon/Argon.php@createFromFormatWithCurrentLocale()` method it result in an Carbon issue :

Carbon\Exceptions\InvalidFormatException with message 'Unexpected data found.

pull_request.title: Allow wishlist load by page parameter
pull_request.body:
This PR is aimed to allow Wishlist page to load a specific wish list item by passing his hashed Id as parameter.   
**The `id` parameter must be set with an hash id** : `https://mall.offline.swiss/en/wishlists/r8dolq6Z`.
```twig
title = "Wishlists"
url = "/wishlists/:id?"
layout = "default"
is_hidden = 0

[viewBag]
localeUrl[de] = "/wunschlisten/:id?"

[wishlists]
showShipping = 1
==
{% component 'wishlists' %}
```
If no id parameter is passed, the defaut behavior is used and the first item of the list get loaded.  

This can be useful if you dynamically build a wishlist from the items in the store (example project configurator) and you want to  redirect the visitor to this newly created list.

commits.message:
Update Address columns definition

I see that event in the demo site, the `customer` column when viewing addresses is always empty.  
This modification add the correct information to the column.  
The column was rename to suit October's documentation : 
> Be careful not to name relations the same as existing database columns. For example, using a name group_id could break the group relation due to a naming conflict.
see : [Backend / Lists / Relation](https://docs.octobercms.com/2.x/backend/lists.html#relation)

issue.title: Add price accessors to the product model
issue.body:
```php
$product->price // Returns whatever is entered in the backend (with/without taxes)

// To implement:
$product->price_pre_taxes // Returns always the price without taxes
$product->price_post_taxes // Returns always the price with taxes
```

The same accessors are needed for the `old_price` attribute.

An example on how to implement this can be found in the [CartProduct](https://github.com/OFFLINE-GmbH/oc-mall-plugin/blob/develop/models/CartProduct.php#L133) model.
